p: Saposhnikovia divaricata (Turcz.) Schischk. (family Apiaceae) is found in the Northern and Northeastern territories of China, cultivated in many other provinces. As a traditional Chinese medicine, dried root and/or its ethanolic extract are used. It is also used in medical practice in Japan [ 74]. In the Russian Federation, Saposhnikovia divaricata grows in Eastern Siberia and the Far East. The anti-inflammatory, analgesic, antipyretic, anti-allergic, antioxidant, antitumor and antiviral activity of its root extracts has been established [ 75, 76, 77, 78]. Chromones, coumarins, unsaturated fatty acids, volatile oils and polyacetylene compounds were isolated from the chemical composition [ 74, 79, 80]. Polysaccharides of the dried root of Saposhnikovia divaricata possess immunoregulatory and antitumor characteristics [ 77].
